title: Ride with GPS Introduces Collaborative Route Planning
content:
Ride with GPS‘s cycling route planning and navigation just got more collaborative…

The Portland-based company just announced its Collaborative Route Planning feature. This new tool allows route creators to invite fellow cyclists as collaborators, granting them editing permissions to co-design routes seamlessly. The best part? It’s free for all users.

Multiple users can now contribute directly on the route page, with changes and notes saved in a shared space, making the planning process a group effort.

Key Features:

  • Seamless Collaboration: Route owners can invite others to edit and enhance routes, fostering a communal approach to ride planning.
  • Real-Time Updates: Saved changes appear instantly for all collaborators, keeping the route up-to-date in real time.
  • Enhanced Communication: Collaborators can leave notes and feedback right where it matters—on the route itself—making decisions faster and easier.
  • Restore Previous Route Versions: Enjoy worry-free editing with the ability to restore previous versions of your route without fear of losing your painstaking edits.

This feature is now available to all Ride with GPS users. To learn more about Collaborative Route Planning and how to get started, visit Ride With GPS.
